channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI ‚Ä¢ Open Source ‚Ä¢ Security ‚Ä¢ Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: [AINews] WTF Happened in December 2025?
item.description: A quiet day lets us express a growing, uneasy feeling that coding has changed forever — much much more than “normal” hype.

item.title: Increased latency with the Cloudflare One Client connected to datacenters in the Texas region
item.description: Feb 25, 23:55 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved.Feb 25, 23:10 UTCInvestigating - Multiple users in the Texas region may experience performance degradation and increased latency while using the Cloudflare One Client (formerly known as the Cloudflare WARP client). item.title: Roundtables: Why 2026 Is the Year for Sodium-Ion Batteries
item.description: Listen to the session or watch below Sodium-based batteries could be a cheaper, safer alternative to lithium-ion, and the technology is finally making its way into cars‚Äîand energy storage arrays on the grid. Sodium-ion batteries are one of MIT Technology Review’s 10 Breakthrough Technologies...

item.title: Google Disrupts UNC2814 GRIDTIDE Campaign After 53 Breaches Across 42 Countries
item.description: Google on Wednesday disclosed that it worked with industry partners to disrupt the infrastructure of a suspected China-nexus cyber espionage group tracked as UNC2814 that breached at least 53 organizations across 42 countries. "This prolific, elusive actor has a long history of targeting...

item.title: üî¨Searching the Space of All Possible Materials ‚Äî Prof. Max Welling, CuspAI
item.description: Editor’s note: CuspAI raised a $100m Series A in September and is rumored to have reached a unicorn valuation. They have all-star advisors from Geoff Hinton to Yann Lecun and team of deep domain experts

item.title: Workers Cron Triggers not firing
item.description: Feb 25, 17:30 UTCResolved - Cloudflare is aware of and has mitigated an issue which impacted Workers Cron Triggers not firing for some customers. This impacted some users from 17:54 to 18:18 UTC.

item.title: Claude Code Flaws Allow Remote Code Execution and API Key Exfiltration
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed multiple security vulnerabilities in Anthropic's Claude Code, an artificial intelligence (AI)-powered coding assistant, that could result in remote code execution and theft of API credentials. item.description: Feb 25, 16:30 UTCResolved - Between 16:32 and 16:38 UTC, a connectivity degradation occurred in Hamburg, Germany datacenter.

item.title: The Blast Radius Problem: Stolen Credentials Are Weaponizing Agentic AI
item.description: More than half (56%) of the 400,000 vulnerabilities IBM X-Force tracked in 2025 required no authentication before exploitation. The post The Blast Radius Problem: Stolen Credentials Are Weaponizing Agentic AI appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Google Disrupts Chinese Hackers Targeting Telecoms, Governments
item.description: The UNC2814 threat actor has been active since at least 2017, targeting organizations across 42 countries. The post Google Disrupts Chinese Hackers Targeting Telecoms, Governments appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SolarWinds Patches Four Critical Serv-U Vulnerabilities
item.description: The four security defects could be exploited for remote code execution but require administrative privileges. The post SolarWinds Patches Four Critical Serv-U Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SLH Offers $500‚Äì$1,000 Per Call to Recruit Women for IT Help Desk Vishing Attacks
item.description: The notorious cybercrime collective known as Scattered LAPSUS$ Hunters (SLH) has been observed offering financial incentives to recruit women to pull off social engineering attacks. The idea is to hire them for voice phishing campaigns targeting IT help desks, Dataminr said in a new threat brief....

item.title: Top 5 Ways Broken Triage Increases Business Risk Instead of Reducing It
item.description: Triage is supposed to make things simpler. In a lot of teams, it does the opposite. When you can‚Äôt reach a confident verdict early, alerts turn into repeat checks, back-and-forth, and ‚Äújust escalate it‚Äù calls. That cost doesn‚Äôt stay inside the SOC; it shows up as missed SLAs, higher cost per case,...

item.title: Medical Device Maker UFP Technologies Hit by Cyberattack
item.description: UFP Technologies appears to have been targeted in a ransomware attack that involved data theft and file-encrypting malware. The post Medical Device Maker UFP Technologies Hit by Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Download: introducing the Crime issue
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Introducing: the Crime issue Technology has long made crime and its prosecution a game of cat and mouse. But those same new technologies that have...

item.title: Ex-US Defense Contractor Executive Jailed for Selling Exploits to Russia
item.description: Peter Williams was sentenced to 87 months in prison for selling cyber exploits to a Russian broker. The post Ex-US Defense Contractor Executive Jailed for Selling Exploits to Russia appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Malicious NuGet Packages Stole ASP.NET Data; npm Package Dropped Malware
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered four malicious NuGet packages that are designed to target ASP.NET web application developers to steal sensitive data. The campaign, discovered by Socket, exfiltrates ASP.NET Identity data, including user accounts, role assignments, and permission mappings,...

item.title: Listen to Earth‚Äôs rumbling, secret soundtrack
item.description: The boom of a calving glacier. The crackling rumble of a wildfire. The roar of a surging storm front. They‚Äôre the noises of the living Earth, music of this one particular sphere and clues to the true nature of these dramatic events. But as loud as all these things are, they emit even more...

item.title: 3 things Juliet Beauchamp is into right now
item.description: The only reality show that matters The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City is one of the best shows on television right now. Not one of the best reality TV shows, but one of the best TV shows, period. Chronicling a shifting group of wealthy women in and around Salt Lake, the show has featured…

item.title: Now is a good time for doing crime
item.description: Eons ago, in 2012, I had a weird experience. My iPhone suddenly shut down. When I restarted it, I found it was totally reset‚Äîclean, like a new device. This was the early days of iOS, so I wasn‚Äôt too concerned until I went to connect it to my computer to restore it from a backup.…

item.title: Alibaba Cloud Launches ‚ÄúUltimate Coding Plan‚Äù with Four Top-Tier Open-Source Models
item.description: Alibaba Cloud is redefining AI coding subscriptions by enabling developers to freely switch among multiple top-tier open-source models under a single plan.

item.title: 2026 XPeng X9 All-Electric MPV Set for March 2 Launch: The World‚Äôs Longest-Range Seven-Seater EV
item.description: XPeng is set to launch the 2026 all-electric X9, the world‚Äôs longest-range seven-seater MPV, combining ultra-fast charging, AI-powered driving, and advanced winter performance.

item.title: Alipay‚Äôs ‚ÄúAI Pay‚Äù Surpasses 100 Million Active Users, Ushering in the Era of Conversational Shopping
item.description: Alipay‚Äôs AI Pay has exceeded 100 million users, demonstrating that conversational, hands-free shopping is becoming mainstream.

item.title: Rsemi Secures Strategic Financing, Focuses on In-Vehicle SerDes and Core Automotive Technologies
item.description: Rsemi secures strategic financing to accelerate development of high-speed in-vehicle SerDes chips and scale its automotive technology offerings.

item.title: AGIBOT Expands into Europe with Germany Launch, Accelerating Localized Robot Deployment
item.description: AGIBOT enters the German market, showcasing a full lineup of humanoid and quadruped robots while partnering with Minth Group to accelerate European deployment.

item.title: Multilevel Determinants of Overweight and Obesity Among U.S. Children Aged 10-17: Comparative Evaluation of Statistical and Machine Learning Approaches Using the 2021 National Survey of Children's Health
item.description: arXiv:2602.20303v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Background: Childhood and adolescent overweight and obesity remain major public health concerns in the United States and are shaped by behavioral, household, and community factors. Their joint predictive structure at the population level remains...

item.title: An artificial intelligence framework for end-to-end rare disease phenotyping from clinical notes using large language models
item.description: arXiv:2602.20324v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Phenotyping is fundamental to rare disease diagnosis, but manual curation of structured phenotypes from clinical notes is labor-intensive and difficult to scale. Existing artificial intelligence approaches typically optimize individual components of...

item.title: DMCD: Semantic-Statistical Framework for Causal Discovery
item.description: arXiv:2602.20333v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present DMCD (DataMap Causal Discovery), a two-phase causal discovery framework that integrates LLM-based semantic drafting from variable metadata with statistical validation on observational data. In Phase I, a large language model proposes a...

item.title: Diffusion Modulation via Environment Mechanism Modeling for Planning
item.description: arXiv:2602.20422v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Diffusion models have shown promising capabilities in trajectory generation for planning in offline reinforcement learning (RL). However, conventional diffusion-based planning methods often fail to account for the fact that generating trajectories in...

item.title: Implicit Intelligence -- Evaluating Agents on What Users Don't Say
item.description: arXiv:2602.20424v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Real-world requests to AI agents are fundamentally underspecified. Natural human communication relies on shared context and unstated constraints that speakers expect listeners to infer. Current agentic benchmarks test explicit instruction-following...

item.title: Tensor Network Generator-Enhanced Optimization for Traveling Salesman Problem
item.description: arXiv:2602.20175v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present an application of the tensor network generator-enhanced optimization (TN-GEO) framework to address the traveling salesman problem (TSP), a fundamental combinatorial optimization challenge. Our approach employs a tensor network Born machine...

item.title: MoBiQuant: Mixture-of-Bits Quantization for Token-Adaptive Elastic LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2602.20191v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Changing runtime complexity on cloud and edge devices necessitates elastic large language model (LLM) deployment, where an LLM can be inferred with various quantization precisions based on available computational resources. However, it has been...

item.title: FedAvg-Based CTMC Hazard Model for Federated Bridge Deterioration Assessment
item.description: arXiv:2602.20194v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Bridge periodic inspection records contain sensitive information about public infrastructure, making cross-organizational data sharing impractical under existing data governance constraints. We propose a federated framework for estimating a...

item.title: Controllable Exploration in Hybrid-Policy RLVR for Multi-Modal Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2602.20197v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reinforcement Learning with verifiable rewards (RLVR) has emerged as a primary learning paradigm for enhancing the reasoning capabilities of multi-modal large language models (MLLMs). However, during RL training, the enormous state space of MLLM and...

item.title: IMOVNO+: A Regional Partitioning and Meta-Heuristic Ensemble Framework for Imbalanced Multi-Class Learning
item.description: arXiv:2602.20199v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Class imbalance, overlap, and noise degrade data quality, reduce model reliability, and limit generalization. Although widely studied in binary classification, these issues remain underexplored in multi-class settings, where complex inter-class...

item.title: Talking to Yourself: Defying Forgetting in Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2602.20162v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Catastrophic forgetting remains a major challenge when fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) on narrow, task-specific data, often degrading their general knowledge and reasoning abilities. We propose SA-SFT, a lightweight self-augmentation routine...

item.title: Benchmarking Distilled Language Models: Performance and Efficiency in Resource-Constrained Settings
item.description: arXiv:2602.20164v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Knowledge distillation offers a transformative pathway to developing powerful, yet efficient, small language models (SLMs) suitable for resource-constrained environments. In this paper, we benchmark the performance and computational cost of distilled...

item.title: ConceptRM: The Quest to Mitigate Alert Fatigue through Consensus-Based Purity-Driven Data Cleaning for Reflection Modelling
item.description: arXiv:2602.20166v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In many applications involving intelligent agents, the overwhelming volume of alerts (mostly false) generated by the agents may desensitize users and cause them to overlook critical issues, leading to the so-called ''alert fatigue''. A common strategy...

item.title: InterviewSim: A Scalable Framework for Interview-Grounded Personality Simulation
item.description: arXiv:2602.20294v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Simulating real personalities with large language models requires grounding generation in authentic personal data. Existing evaluation approaches rely on demographic surveys, personality questionnaires, or short AI-led interviews as proxies, but lack...

item.title: What Makes a Good Query? Measuring the Impact of Human-Confusing Linguistic Features on LLM Performance
item.description: arXiv:2602.20300v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Model (LLM) hallucinations are usually treated as defects of the model or its decoding strategy. Drawing on classical linguistics, we argue that a query's form can also shape a listener's (and model's) response. We operationalize this...

item.title: [AINews] The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Closing the Loop

item.title: Claude Code for Finance + The Global Memory Shortage: Doug O'Laughlin, SemiAnalysis
item.description: A special double pod on the 1 year anniversary of Claude Code: we chat with one of its most vocal fans, who thinks it will write 25-50% of all code on GitHub, plus get a breakdown on the memory crunch

item.title: Spa3R: Predictive Spatial Field Modeling for 3D Visual Reasoning
item.description: While Vision-Language Models (VLMs) exhibit exceptional 2D visual understanding, their ability to comprehend and reason about 3D space--a cornerstone of spatial intelligence--remains superficial. Current methodologies attempt to bridge this domain gap either by relying on explicit 3D modalities or...

item.title: The Diffusion Duality, Chapter II: $Œ®$-Samplers and Efficient Curriculum
item.description: Uniform-state discrete diffusion models excel at few-step generation and guidance due to their ability to self-correct, making them preferred over autoregressive or Masked diffusion models in these settings. However, their sampling quality plateaus with ancestral samplers as the number of steps...
